title: Cricket Batsman Skill Behavior Analysis and Language-Based Simulation Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic cricket rules and batting techniques, foundational sports psychology concepts, basic sports-related vocabulary and communication skills
context.additional_context: In BYOD environments, learners use personal mobile devices (tablets/smartphones) to perform data collection and analysis. Real-time coaching is supported through linguistic interactions (voice/text feedback).

learning_goals: Learners can linguistically analyze and evaluate a cricket batter’s behavior (shot selection, technical efficiency), cognition (strategic thinking), and emotion (psychological stability) in a simulation game environment.
Learners can identify external outcome-driven strategic thinking through linguistic feedback (80%+ accuracy) by comparing experts and novices.
Learners can establish and execute personalized skill improvement plans based on individual batting data (ball contact accuracy, scoring rate) and linguistic self-assessment reports.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
